intro: Gaultheria rubidiflora, commonly known as the red-flowered wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and cranberries. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Gaultheria rubidiflora produces small, dark blue berries that are edible and have a sharp, peppery flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
